CatDescriptText: Mr. Frank Thompson, 6440 Frankstown Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 30, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "Does the financial aid, given young married couples by parents, encourage or dissuade the latter's realization of marital responsibilities?" Answer reads: "I don't think that financial aid should be given by parents to young married couples.  The persons getting married should have enough responsibility to get out and work.  I think that aid by the parents hinders the assumption of the responsibilities.  Because you've been with your parents from the day you were born.  I think that when you get married you should get out on your own."
TitMainTitle: Frank Thompson posed in front of store windows, one on left with posted article reading "Speaking of Beauty...Gus Brunn," one on right inscribed "B & B... travel..."
